Reviews.Title: “Just Drive on By and Don't Stop”
Reviews.Author: A Y
Reviews.Content: Over the past ten years we have routinely stayed at this hotel on the Eastern edge of Memphis. Nicely landscaped with small lake in a business park, it almost beckons one to stop and stay. The interior is almost the opposite of the surrounding property. We haven't stayed here in three years, and what a change this place has made in that time. Apparently Mgmt. has ignored cleaning and maintenance since our last stay. First hint was that the latch portion portion of the door jam was missing. Walking into the room the carpet was filthy and appeared that it had not been vacuumed in a while. Behind the door was a pile of dust and pieces of cereal. The carpet was frayed around the edges and had many stains in it. More observations: bathroom sink drained very slowly and had a stinking odor, rust stains in tub, black mold around and under tub caulking, black mold around edge of tub surround. water temperature control nob in tub broken off, tub drain plug broken in half, dark spots on bathroom floor, white and black stains in front of bathroom sink. brown stains on sink counter, couch cushions covered with black stains and strong odor emitted from couch when sat upon. no cold water from kitchenette sink faucet, bottom drawer of dresser broken, black dirt marks on all walls. Sheets appeared to clean, but when they were rolled back, a cricket jumped out from under them. On the positive the air conditioners seem to be new. The front desk said they had one other room, but upon inspection, it was just a filthy. Front desk did lend me a vacuum cleaner so that I could vacuum the room carpet. They also lent us a sheet to cover the couch and a rubber tub pad to cover the bottom of the club (although it took quite a while for them to find one). This use to be quite a nice place to stay, but now, it needs to be bulldozed down. Only stay here to get out of the rain.

Reviews.Title: “This place is nasty and dirty”
Reviews.Author: plove_11
Reviews.Content: I will never stay here again. The price was good but this is because they do not clean. This places is old they need an upgrade bad. I have been here for six days no one has cleaned my room in fact they said you have to pay for it. That is nasty. huge spider webs, dirty shower, no toilet paper, dirty sheets, old TV, leaking ceilings, dirty carpet as you walk down the hall and in your room. I will pay to stay somewhere clean next time I come to Memphis. This places need to be torn down I'm serious.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has really gone down hill since I stayed here last year.”
Reviews.Author: Jackofalltrades305
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here last year, it was at least half way decent. Courtesy Staff, as a matter of fact, her name was I think Rose. The room was pretty clean so I kept in mind when planning my next stay in Memphis. This time, it was HORRIFIC!!! The room, the bathroom and even the kitchen was pure nasty. The towels had hair in them and they were dingy looking like they weren't even washed. The dishes in the dishwasher were filthy with caked on food. The carpets had stains and were dirty. They ruined a perfectly good pair of socks. Why doesn't the manager check these rooms out on a regular basis? The maid service is very, very, very POOR!!! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Disgusting Place I Have Ever Stayed!”
Reviews.Author: TTOTennessee
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel experience I have ever had. Filthy carpet, furniture and bathroom. Every corner of this room was covered in stains of Lord only knows what. There were so many stains on the bedding and couch my husband had to go buy sheets at Wal-mart for us to sleep and sit on. Air conditioner was broken. Bedroom lights were broken. Air unit was covered in filth, grime and mold and was missing pieces. The tub had a large, yellow/brown sludge in it--so dirty we refused to shower. Our non-smoking room had apparently been smoked in by every previous tenant...ashes everywhere and an overwhelming smoke odor that burned our eyes and caused coughing. The common areas were just as filthy as the room. I had my two year old with me, and would not let him touch anything or sit anywhere unless it was covered by the bedding we purchased. We would have checked out the minute we saw the room if it wasn't midnight. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total dump.”
Reviews.Author: btumid
Reviews.Content: I found a really great rate for a Thursday night. I thought, hey! How bad can it be? Hmmm. Looks/smells as though a college fraternity or out-of-control rock band partied hard in this room. Stains all over the hallway, missing chunks of wall, dresser drawers broken off, warped sofa bed, refrigerator containing last guest's trash, We would have asked to switch rooms, but we barely had enough time to sleep a full night after 12 hours in the car and two hours visiting an old friend in town. Plus, what we saw in the hallways indicated we wouldn't fare much better in another room. STEER CLEAR of this hotel. Seriously. I would have paid double for a different room at a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reduce your stay at Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: jimjade3
Reviews.Content: We had reservations in Nashville but due to a blinding rainstorm, we made our way to this hotel for the night. It seemed nice enough from the exterior and the clerk was courteous. We were grateful they had a room and at sixty something dollars, it seemed okay. They had no luggage cart so we made several trips from car to room. In the corridor was this big furry blob. Relieved that it was not a rat, we found it to be a pile of hair extension. There were arguments coming from the neighbor's door in languages I've never heard. We got into our room and found it, like some others on this site, pretty nasty. Dirty, stained carpet and similar condition for the furniture. There was moldy caulking in the bathroom. It was the kind of place which makes you wonder if an owner lives in a place which is this bad, if he just doesn't want to make any improvement, or if he is just clueless. The worst part was that we had to get up at 4 a.m. to make it to our reserved tour at Mammoth Cave.... and the front desk did not honor our request for a wake-up call and the alarm clock did not work either. This place was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “I think I will purchase their stock.”
Reviews.Author: kjazzy54
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days & 4 nights. The room was clean, spacious and modern. The staff was friendly and courteous. My family and I came to Memphis for the International BBQ Festival and had a ball. I have no regrets and have determined that I will only stay at Extended Stay Hotels from this point on weather for leisure or business. The pool was not open for our stay and I never asked why, but that would be my only small dislike just wanted my 3 grandsons to enjoy the pool they were kind of looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge a Book By it's Cover”
Reviews.Author: btctravel
Reviews.Content: Our original reservation was two miles down the road at the sister Hotel Studio Suites. When we arrived we were told that they no longer had the double bed with sleeper sofa that we had reserved a week prior. We were told that the flood victims were taking the rooms. I'm ok with that I understand emergencies happen. So we had two options #1 take a room there with 1 queen bed and sofa bed or #2 transfer to the sister Hotel Extended Stay Deluxe. We went with option #2 after being told that the Extended Stay was much nicer, breakfast included, and outdoor pool. When we arrived we were really excited it had really looked like we had upgraded and still kept the good rate. DON'T JUDGE A BOOK BY IT'S COVER- Our first room had huge stains in the carpet and the counter tops were dirty in the kitchen. We called the front desk and then were escorted to another room that was still in need of a good carpet cleaning and a fresh paint job and the air was not cooling the room. We were then upgraded to a 2 room suite at no charge the only perk here was that we had to televisions. We gave up and stayed in the suite but I hated it and if I could do it over again I would of canceled the reservation and gone somewhere else. Couch was filthy ( I put a blanket over it to sit on) Carpet was worn dirty ( we wore our socks the whole time) Sheet had stain on it ( I changed it out with the front desk) No DVD in Room as advertised Cabinets and walls look beaten IN NEED OF Paint Job Bathroom was disgusting-- Believe it or not I had to clean it myself Rusty bathtub Our Free Breakfast consisted of muffins, Fruit, and coffee Never Again Ceanliness is a MUST HAVE I will not make the same mistake twice!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WIFFEE123
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with the Hotel as soon as I walked into my room. The room was very spacious. This is the perfect Hotel if your traveling with your kids! I felt like I was at home. The rooms are equiped with everything. The guest service was warming. Extended Stay Deluxe will be my first choice when traveling for now on.

Reviews.Title: “Would be a good value - if not for internet charges”
Reviews.Author: JimmyEv
Reviews.Content: You get a nice (if generic) little kitchenette in the room, a nice bed, and a decent TV. The staff was friendly. But, if you're going to market yourself to a business clientele, you better not charge for wireless. Period. And the fact that the phone didn't work for dial-up reeked.

Reviews.Title: “Comfty Friendly Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelnMan1
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Memphis location. Just like the 1st trip the staff was super friendly and accommodating. They greet you with a smile and always offer assistance to make your stay a pleasant one. to put it short my stay felt like I was at a relatives. Keep up the good work guys. Love your customer service, and I should know because I train employees at my company in the art of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: ProfessionalLady
Reviews.Content: I went to Memphis on a business trip and I stayed at the Extended Stay Deluxe Memphis-Wolfchase Galleria. The rooms were clean and fresh. The staff was wonderful and courteous. I had about 1,000 questions and they answered them all. If you are in the Memphis area and looking for a really nice AFFORDABLE place to stay during your visit, then the Extended Stay Deluxe Memphis-Wolfchase Galleria is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Business_Pleasure3
Reviews.Content: Condition of rooms: The first room they gave us wasn't even clean. The second ("clean") room had stains on the couch; old food in the kitchen; the cheapest furniture I've ever seen; the television didn't have one clear channel on it; The bedding had an odd smell to it; the pillows were so cheap and flat that it was as if we weren't even sleeping on pillows; several of the light bulbs/lamps were nonfunctional; there were no sheets for the pullout couch. Condition of property: The pool area, even though it was closed, looked junky (our room overlooked the pool); several chairs had been thrown onto the pool cover and things were strewn about. The music in the lobby was the most depressing, horrible noise that we've ever heard - even our children remarked on it. Amenity Issues: In-room internet was advertised but it turns out there is an extra charge for it. A pullout couch is advertised but no linens for it were in the room, forcing us to go downstairs and wait while they "found" them. A continental breakfast was advertised but the offerings were extremely sparse - a couple of muffins and bagels and a few pieces of fruit. The maintenece workers had cleared much of the "breakfast" out. Service quality: When arriving in Memphis we called ahead to see if we could go ahead and check in -- we were assured that we could. After fighting the mall traffic for thirty minutes to get to the hotel, we were forced to wait for at least twenty five minutes while the desk person took other guests ahead of us because "she couldn't check us in right away", even though we'd called ahead and been told we could. (There weren't more than ten cars in the whole lot, either at that point or much later on that evening; this hotel was NOT full or busy.) Once we were checked in, we got to the room to find that it was dirty (unmade beds, dishes in the sink) and had to drag all our luggage and kids back downstairs and wait longer until she gave us a different room. Another unduly long wait to get linens for the pullout couch; and yet another to check out. The room was reserved on Hotwire. We were charge another twenty five dollars upon arriving because we needed two double beds instead of a queen room. We will NEVER stay in another Extendedstay hotel, and we will probably never use Hotwire again because of the chance of getting such substandard accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: icee
Reviews.Content: This was my worst ever priceline experience. Our room stinked, stank, stunk! We arrrived late and the person that checked us in was not very nice. I had called a few days earlier to see if we could get a room with 2 double beds or a room with a king and a sleeper sofa. I was told that I could "upgrade" for $25. I also asked to be put in nonsmoking. Since the grandgirls had decided to go with us, I agreed to pay the upgrade. Of course when we got there they still had us assigned to a queen 1 bed with no sofa bed. Well the super friendly (NOT) desk clerk changed our room assignment while she grunted and groaned and huffed and puffed. We finally got to the room and it literally stunk....of course, we had been put in a smoking room. You could smell smoke as soon as you got off the elevator. Since it was so late we stayed in the room. I checked to make sure the sheets were clean and they were. We were put on the interstate side of the hotel and you could hear traffic all night long. It was like the cars were going to come thru the window any moment. When I checked out they charged me $35.99 + tax for the upgrade. I did not say a word about the overcharge. They definitely need the money more than I do. Maybe it can be used for a renovation. The website says they have done a complete renovation. Well, I don't know where they spent the money, but it wasn't in the stinky, stanky, stunky rooms. This place is literally the pits. By the time I paid the priceline rate and the upgrade charge the room cost $75.99 plus tax. It wasn't even worth the $40 that I paid thru priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, could be a little better”
Reviews.Author: ClipperCapt
Reviews.Content: Traveling on business, arrived Sunday evening. Stayed until Thursday. Hotel is difficult to get to, located on access road behind a shopping center, visible from highway, but no good signs or directions to get to the front door. Desk clerk said they didn't have the king, non-smoking suite as reserved and wanted to downgrade (of course). However did up-grade (when I refused) to an "Executive suite". Room was nice, however it was located on the front side of the hotel, a stones-throw from I-40, and with single pane widows, it was not a quiet room. Also had the spot lights for lighting the exterior of the building pointed directly at the windows. Some odd things about the room. Only one(1) waste basket for the entire suite. Would expect to have one in the bath, and one in the bedroom too. Desk was in the bedroom, however no electrical outlets, phone, or modem jacks anywhere near. All that was located next to the breakfast bar in the kitchen/living area, so that became the desk. Towel bar next to sinks in bath had been torn off and was laying in the closet of the bath dressing area. Continental breakfast was very limited, and sometimes empty at 7:15 am after construction crews staying there had been through. Not a bad stay, but then not really impressive either.

Reviews.Title: “An OK room if you don't need much sleep....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Memphis on business from September 8-10, 2004 and I stayed at this hotel. On the positive side the room was large and clean, the staff was friendly, and the location of the hotel is in a safe neighborhood with lots of restuarants and shopping. However, the bed was extremely uncomfortable and both panes in the double-pane window were broken allowing a lot of noise from the interstate to come into the room. I would think that would be a safety concern as well. The room in general was very worn and in need of many renovations. I won't be staying here again anytime soon.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay Deluxe Memphis-Wolfchase Galleria
HotelInfo.Address: 2520 Horizon Lake Drive, Memphis, TN 38133
